intro: Peucedanum tenuifolium, commonly known as narrow-leaved angelica, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and flowering stems. It is native to Central Asia and grows in temperate regions, often in moist, woodland environments. The plant features finely divided, feather-like leaves and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. Its seeds are used in traditional medicine and as a spice, similar to other members of its family. The plant's botanical structure supports its role in both ecological and culinary contexts.
